timeline.message:
Replace oc with kubectl and fix syntax of `--selector`

Signed-off-by: Simon Woodman <swoodman@redhat.com>

timeline.bodyText:
Should this be:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            kubectl get all --selector strimzi.io/cluster=my-connect-cluster -o name
          
          
            
            kubectl get kctr --selector strimzi.io/cluster=my-connect-cluster -o name
          
      
    
    
  

all will not show the connector resource.
timeline.author: scholzj
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -43,12 +43,12 @@ spec:
 +
 [source,shell,subs="+quotes"]
 ----
-oc apply -f examples/connector/source-connector.yaml
+kubectl apply -f examples/connector/source-connector.yaml
 ----
 
 . Check that the resource was created:
 +
 [source,shell,subs="+quotes"]
 ----
-oc get all --selector strimzi.io/cluster: my-connect-cluster -o name
+kubectl get all --selector strimzi.io/cluster=my-connect-cluster -o name

replies.bodyText: As an aside: we could configure our CRs so that we could do kubectl get strimzi to show all Strimzi resources, if people think that's useful?
replies.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText: I think that would be handy
replies.author: scholzj

replies.bodyText:
Thinking about this... I'm not aware that we've documented the shortnames for our CRs.  @laidan6000 can you confirm? We probably should.
In any case we should be consistent in the docs to always use shortnames or always use long names in order to avoid confusing readers who are not familiar with kube's many ways of spelling resource types.
replies.author: tombentley

replies.bodyText:
You're correct. We haven't documented the shortnames in full.
I found a single reference to shortnames in the Kafka topic CRD example:

"The shortname can be used in CLI commands. For example, oc get kt can be used as an abbreviation instead of oc get kafkatopic."
replies.author: laidan6000

timeline.message:
Fixed get command
